transportAdvice: Leipzig has an efficient public transit network of trams, buses, and S-Bahn trains that connect the city centre with most tourist areas, making it easy to get around without a car. The compact inner city is very walkable, and taxis are readily available for longer journeys or late-night travel.

weather.description: Cold and grey with occasional frost or light snow; pack warm layers and a waterproof jacket.
Still cold and wintry with some chance of snow, though days begin to lengthen slightly.
Early spring brings milder temperatures and occasional sunny spells, though cool winds persist.
Pleasant spring weather with blooming parks; light rain showers are common so carry an umbrella.
Warm and green with longer days; one of the most enjoyable months to explore the city outdoors.
Warm early summer with occasional thunderstorms; outdoor cafes and parks are lively.
The warmest month with long sunny days, though brief afternoon thunderstorms are possible.
Warm and summery with similar conditions to July; a great time for outdoor events and festivals.
Early autumn brings cooler evenings and golden foliage; comfortable for sightseeing.
Noticeably cooler and increasingly overcast; a light jacket and layers are advisable.
Cold and often damp with limited daylight; Christmas market season begins late in the month.
Cold and festive with popular Christmas markets; occasional frost or light snow adds to the atmosphere.
